content:
advertisement

New rules from the Immigration and Naturalization Service INS could decrease the number of international students at Penn State PERIOD

Last fall Penn State University Park was home to  international students PERIOD The numbers for this year are not yet available PERIOD

Its too early to tell how much the INS changes will affect Penn State said Jim Lynch director of international students and scholars PERIOD

The Student and Exchange Visitor Information System SEVIS a service proposed May  is a program that will help universities file international students personal and background information with the government PERIOD

The Issue at a Glance Changes to Immigrant and Naturalization Service

All universities accepting international students must now apply and be approved by the U.S PERIOD attorney general PERIOD Nonimmigrant students will only be allowed to attend approved schools PERIOD Students already attending American schools must file information with the Student and Exchange Visitor Information System a program that files international students background information PERIOD More than  students could not obtain student visas this fall PERIOD

Since three of the Sept PERIOD  hijackers were in the United States with student visas INS policies will become increasingly more strict Lynch said PERIOD

In a rush for the SEVIS service to be implemented Congress has set a Jan PERIOD  deadline for the SEVIS system to be mandatory for all schools and the new INS policy will be in place PERIOD

 Lynch said PERIOD

Section  of the Immigration and Nationality Act permits a nonimmigrant visa for students wishing to study and attend an academic institution in the United States PERIOD

All universities accepting international students will now have to apply and be approved by the U.S PERIOD attorney general PERIOD Only then nonimmigrants will be allowed to attend approved schools PERIOD

Students already attending American academic institutions must also file information with SEVIS PERIOD Because of this students who have already completed part of their degree requirements might not be eligible to finish because of flaws in their records PERIOD

 said Rubina Javeri president of Undergraduate Student Government PERIOD 

While more than  students could not obtain student visas this fall in effect delaying their schooling in the United States until spring semester others experienced little to no problems at all PERIOD

 Niharika Chaurdia freshmannursing said PERIOD However Chaurida did not experience problems entering the country PERIOD  she said PERIOD

There is also fear among some that the new INS developments will affect students studying abroad PERIOD

 Javeri said PERIOD
